question.body: 2.35 is the point estimate for which of the following?

multiple_choice.choice: The proportion of all newlyweds who have sex more than twice in a typical week.
The mean number of times all newlyweds go out during a typical week.
The mean number of times all newlyweds have sex during a typical week.

response.feedback: Incorrect. We actually do not know how many of the 513 couples reported on having sex more than twice in a typical week. Also, a proportion cannot be 2.35. It must be a number between 0 and 1.

This is not quite right. We cannot actually estimate this mean from the information given in the problem, since all we know is that 171 of the 513 sampled newlyweds go out more than twice in a typical week (and not the actual number of times each couple goes out in a typical week).

Correct. We are told that the mean number of times that the newlyweds in our sample have sex in a typical week is 2.35. 2.35 is, therefore, the point estimate for the mean in the entire population (all newlyweds).
